column4: Hi, I have just manually added a user through command, but when I try to run a script, there is not adequate permission to write to a file. How can I add this?
you are trying to write where and with the new user you are trying ?
yes with new use, and pid file
where is the file
the file is in a home dir
the new users home dir?
I didn't create a dir for the new user
so user2 is trying to write to user1's home dir?
yes
users are normally not given permissions to write to other users home directories
easiest thing would be to add home dir for new user?
I have the same problem when I create a home dir for the new user
I think I need to edit the permissions of the user, is there any tutorial for this?
any other suggestions?
you can use sudo to write to any folder, but be careful
new user not in sudoers file
do you want him to be?
well I just want to be able to run this app as another user
why do you need to access another users home directory to do that?
if that's what it takes, then yes
wont boot
but will install?
the live cd wont
the x64 live cd wont boot on a non 64bit system
